key_points: Lady Gaga, Jennifer Lopez, Garth Brooks, Justin Timberlake, Jon Bon Jovi, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Leslie Jones, Eva Longoria, and Tom Hanks are set to appear during Joe Biden's inauguration festivities.
Biden will be inaugurated as the 46th president of the United States at noon ET on Wednesday.
The inauguration events will be mostly virtual due to the COVID-19 pandemic and recent security concerns.
PIC CEO Tony Allen highlighted the inauguration as a chance to showcase American resilience and unity.
All events will be live-streamed on the Biden inauguration website and various social media platforms.
Garth Brooks emphasizes the non-political nature of his inauguration performance, focusing on unity.
Lady Gaga is scheduled to perform "The Star-Spangled Banner" at the inauguration ceremony.
A virtual "Parade Across America" featuring representatives from all 50 states will follow Biden's swearing-in.
Performers like Justin Timberlake and Jon Bon Jovi have been vocal and active in politics in the past.
The Creative Coalition will host a virtual "Inaugural Ball" with celebrities and politicians in attendance.
